resources.string: GYM Life
Strength Training

Step 1:- Adjust bench to an incline of 30 to 45 degrees.

 Step 2:- Repeat as above.

Step 1:- Lying flat on bench, hold dumbbells directly above chest. Step 2:- Bend elbows slightly and maintain throughout the exercise.

 Step 3:- Open arms to sides. Elbows should remain ‘locked’ in a slightly flexed position.

 Step 4:- When upper arms are parallel to floor, return the weights to the starting position and repeat.

Step 1:- Adjust bench to an incline of 30 to 45 degrees.

 Step 2:- Repeat as above.

Step 1:- Sit upright on bench with dumbbells over head. Make sure back is flat. 

 Step 2:- Lower dumbbells slowly to shoulders.

 Step 3:- When arms are at 90 degrees, press the dumbbells back up and repeat.

Step 1:- Sit on edge of bench, feet flat on the floor. Bend over so chest is almost resting on thighs. 

 Step 2:- Hold dumbbells next to feet and bend arms slightly. Open arms out keeping elbows bent.

 Step 3:- When arms are parallel to floor, slowly lower dumbbells back.

Step 1:- Lie face down on a flat or slightly inclined bench. Hold two dumbbells and let arms hang down.

 Step 2:- Pull dumbbells up towards chest.

 Step 3:- Slowly lower dumbbells back down and repeat.

Step 1:- Lying flat on bench, hold the dumbbells directly above chest, arms extended.

 Step 2:- Lower dumbbells to chest in a controlled manner.

 Step 3:- Press dumbbells back to starting position and repeat.

 Step 4:- Avoid locking elbows.

Step 1:- Holding dumbbells at sides, stand upright with feet slightly less than shoulder width apart.

 Step 2:-Step forward about 2 feet with one foot and bend knee to about 90 degrees. As you plant your foot bend trailing knee so it nearly touches floor.

 Step 3:-Push off with front foot to return to starting position.

 Step 4:-Repeat for the desired number of reps and change legs.

Step 1:- Sit on edge of bench with feet flat on the floor.\ n
 Step 2:- Holding dumbbell place elbow on inside of thigh, just above knee. 

 Step 3:- Curl dumbbell up towards your face. Do not swing back as you lift the weight. 

 Step 4:- Slowly lower the weight and repeat for desired number of reps before switching arms.

Step 1:- Lie flat on bench. Hold dumbbells directly above chest with palms facing each other. Dumbbells should be just about touching each other. 

 Step 2:- Keeping your shoulders locked, let your elbows fold so dumbbells are lowered down to either side of head. 

 Step 3:- Extend both your arms back to start position and repeat.

Step 1:- Stand upright, feet shoulder width apart, knees slightly bent. 

 Step 2:- Keeping dumbbells close to body, raise them to chin. 

 Step 3:- Hold for a count of 2 and slowly lower to start position and repeat.

Step 1:- Stand upright, feet shoulder width apart, knees slightly bent. 

 Step 2:- Keeping arms straight ‘shrug’ shoulders as high as possible and hold for a count of 3. 

 Step 3:- Relax and repeat. 

 Step 4:- Do not roll shoulders backwards as you shrug up.

Step 1:- Adjust bench to a 45 degree incline. 

 Step 2:-Hold dumbbells at sides. Arms should be fully extended. 

 Step 3:-Keep elbows close to body and curl weight up by bending elbows. 

 Step 4:-Slowly lower dumbbells and repeat.

Step 1:- Stand upright with dumbbells at sides. 

 Step 2:- Turn palms inward so they face body. 

 Step 3:- Curl dumbbells up slowly keeping your elbows close to sides.

Step 1:- Set bench so back rest is approx 45 degrees.

 Step 2:- Stand behind the bench. Holding dumbbell rest back of upper arm on back rest, arm fully extended. 

 Step 3:- Keep back of upper arm against back rest and curl dumbbell up towards face. 

 Step 4:- Slowly lower dumbbell until arm is not quite fully extended and repeat for desired number of reps before switching arms.

Step 1:- Stand upright, feet shoulder width apart.

 Step 2:- Hold dumbbell directly above head with arm fully extended. Clasp elbow with free hand for support. 

 Step 3:- Slowly let elbow fold so dumbbell is lowered behind head. 

 Step 4:- Extend arm back to starting position. Repeat for the desired number of reps and switch arms.

Step 1:- Stand upright, knees slightly bent, shoulder width apart. Palms should be towards thighs. 

 Step 2:- Raise one dumbbell directly in front of you.

 Step 3:- When arm is parallel to ground lower dumbbell slowly back. Repeat with the other arm.

Step 1:- Stand upright, knees slightly bent, shoulder width apart, holding dumbbells at sides.

 Step 2:- Bend elbows slightly and raise the dumbbells out to sides. Keep elbows slightly bent throughout.

 Step 3:- When arms are parallel to floor, slowly lower back and repeat.

Step 1:- Stand upright next to bench. Place one knee and hand on bench. Upper body should be parallel to floor. 

 Step 2:- Hold one dumbbell with arm extended. 

 Step 3:- Raise dumbbell up to your midsection keeping back still throughout movement. 

 Step 4:- Slowly lower dumbbell to start position and repeat. After desired number of reps repeat for other arm.

Step 1:- Stand upright, feet shoulder width apart, knees slightly bent.

 Step 2:- Bend lower back and knees to lower the weights down your legs. Back must remain flat, lower back should be arched inwards slightly. Keep head up throughout exercise.

 Step 3:- Stand upright using lower back and legs, maintaining flat back and keeping your head up. 

 Step 4:- Always wear belts before trying new weights, to avoid any injuries.

Step 1:- Stand upright next to bench. Place one arm and leg on bench. Upper body should be parallel to ground. 

 Step 2:- Holding dumbbell raise elbow so upper arm is parallel to ground. Elbow should be bent at right angles. 

 Step 3:- Extend elbow so entire arm is parallel to ground. 

 Step 4:- Slowly return to start position and repeat for desired number of reps before changing arms.

Step 1:- Holding dumbbells at sides, stand upright with your feet shoulder width apart. 

 Step 2:- Bend from knees until thighs are almost parallel to the ground (avoid letting knees turn inwards). 

 Step 3:- Keep back flat, lower back slightly arched inwards and head up. 

 Step 4:- Return to upright position and repeat.

Step 1:- Place forearms on the cushioned arm pads with your back against the back plate and feet hanging down. 

 Step 2:- Slowly bend your knees and lift them towards your chest by contracting your abdominal muscles fully. 

 Step 3:- Hold for as long as you can then slowly return legs to starting position.

Step 1:- Lie with your back flat on the ground, legs together and knees bent. 

 Step 2:- With your knees remaining bent, turn at your waist and bring both of your legs to one side of your body, down to the floor. Your legs should be lying on top of each other. 

 Step 3:- Place your hands behind or at the sides of your head. Flex your abdominal muscles, and lift your shoulders off the floor. Be sure to keep your shoulders straight and level just as you would for a normal crunch. 

 Step 4:- Hold the position for a moment then slowly return back to a flat back on the mat.

Step 1:- Lie with your flat back on the ground. 

 Step 2:- Now raise your legs from the hips vertically. 

 Step 3:- Whilst holding the ground using one hand, lift the other one to it touches the toes and return to initial position. 

 Step 4:- Repeat for 5-10 repetitions per set.

Step 1:- Lie on your back, keep your knees bent, arms at the sides, and keep your back and feet flat on the mat. 

 Step 2:- Crunch forward and to the left, touching your left heel with your left hand and hold. 

 Step 3:- Return slowly to the starting position and repeat the movement on the right side. 

 Step 4:-. Repeat this side-to-side movement until the set is complete.

Step 1:- Lie on your back with your arms straight out to the sides. Lift your legs and bend the knees at a 90-degree angle. 

 Step 2:- Rotate the hips to one side, without letting the legs touch the floor. 

 Step 3:- Lift your legs and return to the starting position. 

 Step 4:- Rotate the hips to the opposite side and repeat until set is complete.

Step 1:- Brace your abs and lift your feet about 6 inches (about 15 cm) off of the floor. 

 Step 2:- Maintain braced abdominal and slowly bend your knees to bring them to your chest while keeping your lower legs parallel to the floor. 

 Step 3:- Reverse the movement by slowly extending your legs. Repeat for 10 to 15 repetitions.

Step 1:- Start lying on your back with bent knees and your hands behind your head. 

 Step 2:- Lift your head, neck and shoulders off the ground by contracting your abdominal muscles. At the same time, lift one bent knee up until your thigh is perpendicular to the floor. 

 Step 3:- Extend your leg as you slowly lower your upper body back down, then repeat.

Step 1:- Lie down on a flat or decline bench. Grip the bench tightly, either by its sides or, if it is a decline bench, by its t-bar. Make your back as flat and solid as possible. 

 Step 2:- Raise your legs up through 90 degrees. It is critical that you keep your body straight and rigid as you raise your legs up. 

 Step 3:- Lower your legs back through the vertical to horizontal 90 degrees. Again, make sure your back and torso remain straight and raised off of the branch.

Step 1:- Lie on your back with your right knee bent and right foot flat on the floor. 

 Step 2:- Push your hips up, keeping your left leg elevated. 

 Step 3:- Pause and slowly return to the starting position.

Step 1:- Hold your body weight using your arms and legs by and straighten up your back. 

 Step 2:- Make sure elbows are under the shoulders and feet are straightened out as well. 

 Step 3:- Push the abdomen as back as you can, pushing the back as high in the air and hold for as long as you can. 

 Step 4:- Hold plank for as long as you can.

Step 1:- Lie with the back down on the ground, hold your hands as high as your head, with knees high in the air. 

 Step 2:- Lift yourself from the abdomen without your hands and try to touch your knees. 

 Step 3:- Move your head along with hands behind your head towards your knees. 

 Step 4:- Twist your torso left and right whilst your hands are behind your head. 

 Step 5:- Repeat with at least 5-10 repetitions per set.

Step 1:- Lie on your back on the ground, with your hands stations to your left and right. 

 Step 2:- Raise your legs above waist as high as you can, aim for a 90-degree straight. 

 Step 3:- Slowly lower your legs and repeat.

Step 1:- Lie with the back down on the ground, hold your hands as high as your head, with knees high in the air. 

 Step 2:- Lift yourself from the abdomen without your hands and try to touch your knees, keeping them stable/grounded. 

 Step 3:- Now slowly go back down to your initial position. 

 Step 4:- Repeat with at least 5-10 repetitions per set.

Step 1:- Lie with the back down on the ground, hold your hands as high as your head, with knees high in the air. 

 Step 2:- Lift yourself from the abdomen without your hands and try to touch your knees. 

 Step 3:- Touch your knee to elbow and put pressure on abs. 

 Step 4:- Repeat with at least 5-10 repetitions per set.

Step 1:- Find an elevated surface near you. 

 Step 2:- Position your hands on the elevated surface with your feet pushed as back as you can, with your back straight. 

 Step 3:- Drop your bodily weight slowly towards the ground and lift yourself up towards your initial position. 

 Step 4:- Repeat for as many repetitions as you can.
Text

string-array.name: title_story
string-array.item: Do not skip breakfast
Eat regular meals
Eat plenty of fruit and veg
Get more active
Drink plenty of water
Eat high fibre foods
Read food labels
Eat more fruits and vegetables.
Do not ban foods
Do not stock junk food
Cut down on alcohol
Plan your meals
Be choosy about nighttime snacks
Eat several mini-meals during the day.
Eat protein at every meal.
Always eat breakfast.

string-array.name: detail_story
string-array.item: Do not skip breakfast:- \n\n 1. Skipping breakfast will not help you lose weight. You could miss out on essential nutrients and you may end up snacking more throughout the day because you feel hungry.
Eat regular meals:- \n\n 1. Eating at regular times during the day helps burn calories at a faster rate. It also reduces the temptation to snack on foods high in fat and sugar.

Eat plenty of fruit and veg:- 

 1. Fruit and veg are low in calories and fat, and high in fibre – 3 essential ingredients for successful weight loss. 

 2. They also contain plenty of vitamins and minerals.

Get more active:-

 1. Being active is key to losing weight and keeping it off. As well as providing lots of health benefits, exercise can help burn off the excess calories you cannot lose through diet alone. 

 2. Find an activity you enjoy and are able to fit into your routine.
Drink plenty of water:- \n\n 1. People sometimes confuse thirst with hunger. You can end up consuming extra calories when a glass of water is really what you need.

Eat high fibre foods:- 

 1. Foods containing lots of fibre can help keep you feeling full, which is perfect for losing weight. 

 2. Fibre is only found in food from plants, such as fruit and veg, oats, wholegrain bread, brown rice and pasta, and beans, peas and lentils.

Read food labels:- 

 1. Knowing how to read food labels can help you choose healthier options. 

 2. Use the calorie information to work out how a particular food fits into your daily calorie allowance on the weight loss plan

Eat more fruits and vegetables.:- 

 1. The best "diet" is one where you get to eat more food, not less. 

 2. if you eat fruit and vegetables, you should not feel hungry because these nutrient-rich foods are also high in fiber and water, which give you a feeling of fullness.

Do not ban foods:- 

 1. Do not ignore any food from your diet list. if you love to eat certain food you should have them regardless. 

 2. There is no reason you cannot enjoy the occasional treat as long as you stay within your daily calorie allowance.

Do not stock junk food:- 

 1. To avoid temptation, do not stock junk food such as chocolate, biscuits, crisps and sweet fizzy drinks at home. 

 2. Instead, opt for healthy snacks, such as fruit, unsalted rice cakes, oat cakes, unsalted or unsweetened popcorn, and fruit juice.
Cut down on alcohol:- \n\n 1. A standard glass of wine can contain as many calories as a piece of chocolate. Over time, drinking too much can easily contribute to weight gain

Plan your meals:- 

 1. Try to plan your breakfast, lunch, dinner and snacks for the week, making sure you stick to your calorie allowance. 

 2. You may find it helpful to make a weekly shopping list.

Be choosy about nighttime snacks:- 

 1. Mindless eating occurs most frequently after dinner, when you finally sit down and relax. Snacking in front of the TV is one of the easiest ways to throw your diet off course. 

 2. Either close down the kitchen after a certain hour, or allow yourself a low-calorie snack, like a 100-calorie pack of cookies or a half-cup scoop of low-fat ice cream.

Eat several mini-meals during the day:- 

 1. If you eat fewer calories than you burn, you will lose weight. But when you are hungry all the time, eating fewer calories can be a challenge. 

 2. Studies show people who eat 4-5 meals or snacks per day are better able to control their appetite and weight, says obesity researcher Rebecca Reeves, DrPH, RD.

 3. She recommends dividing your daily calories into smaller meals or snacks and enjoying most of them earlier in the day, dinner should be the last time you eat.

Eat protein at every meal:- 

 1. Protein is the ultimate fill-me-up food. It is more satisfying than carbs or fats and keeps you feeling full for longer. 

 2. It also helps preserve muscle mass and encourages fat burning. So be sure to incorporate healthy proteins like seafood, lean meat, egg whites, yogurt, cheese, soy, nuts, or beans into your meals and snacks.

Always eat breakfast:- 

 1. It seems like an easy diet win, skip breakfast and you will lose weight. 

 2. Yet many studies show the opposite can be true. Not eating breakfast can make you hungry later, leading to too much nibbling and binge eating at lunch and dinner.

 3. To lose weight and keep it off always make time for a healthy morning meal, like high-fiber cereal, low-fat milk, and fruit.
